com.salesforce.androidsdk.app

Class SalesforceSDKManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.salesforce.androidsdk.app.SalesforceSDKManager
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SmartStoreSDKManager

    public class SalesforceSDKManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class serves as an interface to the various functions of the Salesforce SDK. In order to use the SDK, your app must first instantiate the singleton SalesforceSDKManager object by calling the static init() method. After calling init(), use the static getInstance() method to access the singleton SalesforceSDKManager object.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      Action handler in dev support dialog.
      static class  SalesforceSDKManager.Theme
      Available Mobile SDK style themes.

      • shouldLogoutWhenTokenRevoked

        public boolean shouldLogoutWhenTokenRevoked()
        Indicates whether the SDK should automatically log out when the access token is revoked. If you override this method to return false, your app is responsible for handling its own cleanup when the access token is revoked.
        Returns:
        True if the SDK should automatically logout.

      • setPushServiceType

        public void setPushServiceType(java.lang.Class<? extends PushService> pushServiceType)
        Sets the class fulfilling push notification registration features. A default implementation is provided in PushService. Setting this property to a subclass will inject the specified class instead.

        Note, the specified class no longer needs to be specified in the Android manifest as a service.

        Parameters:
        pushServiceType - A class extending PushService

        Returns:

      • shouldBlockSalesforceIntegrationUser

        public boolean shouldBlockSalesforceIntegrationUser()
        Determines if Salesforce integration users will be prohibited from initial authentication.
        Returns:
        True indicates authentication is blocked and false indicates authentication is allowed for Salesforce integration users

      • setBlockSalesforceIntegrationUser

        public void setBlockSalesforceIntegrationUser(boolean value)
        Sets authentication ability for Salesforce integration users. When true, Salesforce integration users will be prohibited from initial authentication and receive an error message. Defaults to false.
        Parameters:
        value - True blocks authentication or false allows authentication for Salesforce integration users

      • setBrowserLoginEnabled

        public void setBrowserLoginEnabled(boolean browserLoginEnabled,
                                   boolean shareBrowserSessionEnabled)
        Sets whether browser based login should be used instead of WebView. This should NOT be used directly by apps, this is meant for internal use, based on the value configured on the server.
        Parameters:
        browserLoginEnabled - True - if Chrome should be used for login, False - otherwise.

      • getUserAgent

        public final java.lang.String getUserAgent()
        Returns a user agent string based on the Mobile SDK version. The user agent takes the following form: SalesforceMobileSDK/{salesforceSDK version} android/{android OS version} appName/appVersion {Native|Hybrid} uid_{device id}
        Returns:
        The user agent string to use for all requests.

      • provideAppName

        public java.lang.String provideAppName()
        Provides the app name to use in getUserAgent(String). This string must only contain printable ASCII characters. By default, the display name under android.content.pm.ApplicationInfo#labelRes will be used.
        Returns:
        The app name to use when constructing the user agent string

      • getUserAgent

        public java.lang.String getUserAgent(java.lang.String qualifier)
        Returns a user agent string based on the Mobile SDK version. The user agent takes the following form: SalesforceMobileSDK/{salesforceSDK version} android/{android OS version} {provideAppName()}/appVersion {Native|Hybrid} uid_{device id}
        Parameters:
        qualifier - Qualifier.
        Returns:
        The user agent string to use for all requests.

      • setTheme

        public void setTheme(SalesforceSDKManager.Theme theme)
        Sets the theme for the SDK. This value only persists as long as the instance of SalesforceSDKManager.
        Parameters:

        See Also:
        SalesforceSDKManager.Theme

      • setViewNavigationVisibility

        public void setViewNavigationVisibility(Activity activity)
        Makes the status and navigation bars visible regardless of style and OS dark theme states.
        Parameters:
        activity - Activity used to set style attributes.
